title: Book Review: Tower of Dawn
body:
Book Review: Tower of Dawn

Tower of Dawn is the sixth book of the Throne of Glass series by Sarah J. Maas.

I bought Throne of Glass about 4-5 years ago and it sat on my bookshelf unread until finally last summer I decided to pick it up and read it. I was immediately mad at myself for not reading it sooner and quickly devoured books 1-5. When Tower of Dawn came out I had heard mixed reviews so I was hesitant to start…

View On WordPress

blog.name: we-are-rogue
blog.title: we are Rogue
blog.description:
Jack of all trades, master of none


Gallery | D&D | Fiction | Theory | Practice | Iconic | Tags and Masterposts

Inspiration and resources for Rogues, the most resourceful player class and fantasy archetype of them all.

Thieves, outlaws, rascals, scoundrels, pickpockets, cutpurses, cat burglars, bandits, con artists, assassins, infiltrators, spies, swashbucklers, highwaymen, smugglers, pirates, thugs, jesters, tricksters, skillmonkeys, specialists, factotums, and the occasional ronin: we are ROGUE.

summary:
Celaena Sardothien by 
Sophie Bangs

  “There
 is... this rage." she said "This despair and hatred and rage that lives
 and...
caption:
Celaena Sardothien by Sophie Bangs

“There is… this rage.“ she said "This despair and hatred and rage that lives and breathes inside me. There’s not sanity to it, no gentleness. It is a monster dwelling under my skin. For the past ten years, I have worked every day, every hour, to keep that monster locked up. And the moment I talk about those two days, and what happened before and after, that monster is going to break loose, and there will be no accounting for what I do.”

Celaena Sardothien from the Heir of Fire series by Sarah J. Maas.

summary: In what time I’ve snatched to read in the past twenty four hours since I bought the book, I’ve read 480 glorious pages of...
body:
In what time I’ve snatched to read in the past twenty four hours since I bought the book, I’ve read 480 glorious pages of Kingdom of Ash.

SJM back at it again, leaving an unforgettable imprint on my life.

“Winged male”
“Beautiful beyond reason”
“His starry sky”
“Dark power like a gentle summer night”
“A shield”
SAVING...
body:
WTF, RHYSAND???????

  • “Fae”
  • “Winged male”
  • “Beautiful beyond reason”
  • “His starry sky”
  • “Dark power like a gentle summer night”
  • “A shield”

THIS IS RHYSAND. FEYRE AND RHYS. WHAT THE FUCK. RHYSAND???

SAVING AELIN?????? Like one more reason for me to LOVE HIM as if I needed one but HOW????? I am DEAD

blog.name: anamgealach
blog.title: Noir Etoil
blog.description: Dreamer. Lives for literature. Various fandoms. Celtic Studies.

body:
Kingdom of Ash.

I finished the last of the books in the ToG series 3 hours ago. I still can’t find the words to even begin expressing my feelings, so this is a start. First of I’m so grateful to Sarah J. Maas for creating this world, for pursuing her dream of seeing the books published and finally for them coming to us the fans, to me as a human being. It was a long journey, but it was so extraordinary an meaningful (even when painful and in a way precisely because of that) that honestly I’m sad it came to an end, but all things do both good and bad. For me the last book couldn’t have been more perfect. I try to keep this post spoiler free, but the arcs of all of the characters were amazing. My favorite, ever since we first met her in HoF is Manon Blackbeak and her development especially in this final book undid me. I’m so proud and happy with what she became, who she became in this book that I have no words to express it. Every page of this book has been a delight. Every book in this and the ACOTAR series an inspiration, to keep moving forward, to keep fighting, to keep healing. Thank you Sarah for giving the world all of this. To the Author who listened and gave us hope for a better world.

blog.name: apileofgoodthings11
blog.title: A Pile of Good Things
blog.description: Former 10th grade English teacher and current teen librarian in a public library. Ask me for book recommendations, especially if you're looking for classroom library selections, curriculum help, and/or tie-ins!

summary:
1. I guess we know why A Court of Frost and Starlight is so short: KOA is 980 pages long! 
2. I’m only 383 pages in, but my...
body:
1. I guess we know why A Court of Frost and Starlight is so short: KOA is 980 pages long!

2. I’m only 383 pages in, but my emotions have already been brutalized!

3. I typically rush through books I love, but with this seventh and final installation, I find myself taking breaks because I don’t want it to end. Celeana/Aelin came into my life when it was pretty heinous, and she showed me how to stand up for myself and how to take my life into my own hands again. Kickass female protagonists always show up to guide me back to life, and I’m thankful I stumbled onto TOG.

4. Anyone else notice the assonance between Throne of GLASS, Kingdom of ASH, and Sarah J. MAAS? It makes my English major heart giddy. 😆

blog.description: Hi! Raena, Here! Welcome to my Massassin Court! Main: @bigmouthpanda

body:
Finished…

It’s done, I have finished Kingdom of Ash.

Honestly I feel like I have no words to describe how… I feel like this book will forever be apart of me.

Just as say Harry Potter is apart of so many others, this book is my Harry Potter. It is something that I strive to write.

Well done Sarah J Maas, well done this book is fantastic amazing beautiful a true work of lituature.

I had to express how I feel, I hope many agree with me in saying; Thank you thank you thank you, Sarah J Maas for writing this series…

*blinks five times*
